intro: Teijsmanniodendron sarawakanum, commonly known as the Sarawak tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its large, leathery leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed, which is often used in traditional medicine. Its growth habit and ecological role make it an important species in the biodiversity of its native habitat.
